meanings.definition: In a natural or raw state, not processed or refined.
meanings.sent1: The crude oil was dark and thick.
meanings.sent2: She made a crude drawing of a tree.
meanings.sent3: His crude attempt at cooking ended in a burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: The crude language used in the movie shocked the audience.
meanings.sent5: The crude wooden table was rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Lacking tact or sensitivity; blunt or offensive in manner.
meanings.sent1: Her crude comment hurt his feelings.
meanings.sent2: He made a crude joke that made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The crude way he spoke made people avoid him.
meanings.sent4: The crude behavior at the party was embarrassing.
meanings.sent5: She regretted her crude remarks immediately.

meanings.definition: Simple or basic in design or form.
meanings.sent1: The crude tools were effective for the job.
meanings.sent2: The house had a crude structure made of logs.
meanings.sent3: His crude invention surprisingly worked well.
meanings.sent4: The crude outline of the plan was enough to get started.
meanings.sent5: The crude drawing captured the essence of the scene.
